data.title: Nia Long Celebrates Her Son Massai, 23, as He Graduates from New York University: 'So Proud of You'
data.meta_description: The actress shares her son with ex Massai Z. Dorsey and is also mom to son Kez, 12
data.text:
The actress shares her son with ex Massai Z. Dorsey and is also mom to son Kez, 12

Nia Long's son is a college graduate!

The actress, 53, shared a sweet photo on Instagram on Monday, May 20, as she celebrated her son Massai Zhivago's college graduation from New York University. In the sweet snap, the mother-son duo smiles together as they pose outside, with Massai, 23, wearing a lei and his cap and gown.

"Oh my baby @massaidorsey I‚Äôm so proud of you! Let‚Äôs get it! Congratulations! #classof2024 #nyugraduation #proudmama ‚ô•Ô∏èüéâ," Long wrote in her caption.

Never miss a story ‚Äî sign up for PEOPLE's free daily newsletter to stay up-to-date on the best of what PEOPLE has to offer, from juicy celebrity news to compelling human interest stories.

Related: Nia Long to Receive $32,000 a Month in Child Support from Ex Ime Udoka

The star shares her older son with ex-fianc√© Massai Z. Dorsey. She is also mom to son Kez Sunday, 12, whom she shares with ex Ime Udoka.

Long and Udoka ended their 13-year relationship in December 2022. Eight months after, Long filed for legal and physical custody of her son Kez after claiming that her ex-fianc√© ‚Äúhas failed‚Äù to support their child.

According to documents obtained by Entertainment Tonight, the You People actress requested that Udoka have "reasonable visitation‚Äù that is ‚Äúconsistent with the child's best interest‚Äù in the paperwork she filed on Aug. 14 in Los Angeles County Superior Court.

The PEOPLE Puzzler crossword is here! How quickly can you solve it? Play now!

This past January, the actress and the NBA coach reached a settlement regarding custody over Kez following the pair's split. According to court documents obtained by PEOPLE, Long is set to receive $32,000 a month in child support from Udoka.

The former couple will continue to share joint custody, but Long will have sole physical custody with reasonable visitation for Udoka. The reason given, per the documents, is Udoka's need to travel with his team, the Houston Rockets, during and around the NBA season.

The stipulation reads, "Udoka shall have reasonable visitation with Kez, which may take into consideration Kez's schedule and concerns but shall not prevent or interfere with Kez's visitation with Udoka."
